transportAdvice: The lake villages are connected by frequent public lanchas (small motorboats) that serve as the primary transit between towns, making walking practical only within individual villages. Tuk-tuks and chicken buses provide local land transport, and taxis are available for longer overland journeys.

weather.description: Cool, dry, and sunny days make January one of the most pleasant months to visit the lake.
Dry season continues with warm afternoons and cool nights, ideal for outdoor activities.
Temperatures rise and conditions remain dry, though afternoon winds on the lake can pick up.
The dry season begins to transition, with occasional light showers possible toward month's end.
Rainy season begins with afternoon showers becoming more frequent, mornings often remain clear.
Heavy afternoon and evening rains are common, but mornings can still offer good visibility across the lake.
Midsummer brings consistent rainfall, though a brief dry spell known as the canícula sometimes occurs.
Rainfall remains heavy and the lake and surrounding hillsides are lush and deeply green.
September is typically the wettest month, with persistent rain and occasional overcast days.
Rain continues through October, though intensity begins to ease toward the end of the month.
The rainy season winds down, with clearer skies returning and cooler, more comfortable temperatures.
Dry season returns with cool nights, clear skies, and excellent views of the surrounding volcanoes.
